intro: Roldana subcymosa, commonly known as the narrow-leafed corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southern China. It belongs to the family Papaveraceae, which includes poppies and other flowering plants with showy blooms. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and clusters of small, pink or purple flowers. Its leaves are typically narrow and alternate along the stem, giving it a distinctive appearance. Roldana subcymosa is often found in rocky or forested habitats at higher elevations.
